name: Dithionous acid
desc: Dithionous acid is a sulfur oxoacid with the chemical formula H2S2O4. It is unstable in pure form, but its salts, known as dithionites, are stable.
Related compounds:
Oxalic acid
Sodium dithionite
Potassium dithionite
standard state:
Except where otherwise noted, data are given for materials in their standard state (at 25 °C [77 °F], 100 kPa).
